text: cox is atrociousnnbefore moving to phoenix we had directv because of the direction our apartment faces the dish could not be installed so we went with cox once our introductory period was up our service became really crappy the hd channels that we pay extra for are fuzzy  jumpy a technician came out a couple of weeks ago and made some repairs and adjustments everything was working fine for about a week and slowly the fuzziness  jumpiness returned in first the hd channels now all the channels are crappy i just finished chatting online with a rep i cant bare to talk to someone on the phone i would curse someone out another technician is coming back on friday this time i requested they replace the digital box oh and we cant access ondemand programming either nnwe havent had any problem with our internet thats why they get 1 star once our contract is up which i hope is soon we are cancelling

last fall i started going to arrichion before they began offering discounted deals through livingsocialgroupon at first i loved everything about it  the heat the instructors the community feel but then the crowds arrived and the studio became overwhelmingly packed ive waited outside for 30 minutes only to be turned away because the class was full it would be great if they offered online signups to avoid this issue additionally the yoga room doesn
disappointing experience with too much similarity
best food i ate during my 5 day stay in vegas by far

hands down this is one of the best spot for concerts in vegas maybe only the cosmo pool tops nnmy husband and i practically live at the beach during the summer  they offer a great variety concerts in a completely laid back and fun atmosphereit really lets you escape the hustle and bustle of the strip weve seen everything from ziggy marley to one republic   nnmy only caution is the drinks are quite expensive and the bar lines are insane  definitely grab some drinks beforehand
when im on campus i choose to eat at this restaurant but i have to admit that the sushi is only passable and overpriced the decor is also not particularly stylish

i was taken advantage of by a different cleaning company so i chose to support a local familyowned business instead noble cleaners exceeded my expectations with their reasonable prices exceptional service and friendly demeanor the two brothers who run the company are hardworking and genuinely care about providing quality service im glad i made the switch and will continue to use their services in the future

if colourful zany standoutfromthecrowd shoes are your thing then theres no better place to go than helen bateman the shoes here are all individual and unique so you definitely wont find them anywhere else in the world and they certainly arent copies of other brands like many shoe companies these bad boys march to the beat of their own drumnni love heels but im a little bit more conservative with shoes going mainly for single colours and printed pumps are usually as adventurous as i go so helen bateman shoes really are for those who like to make a statement with their shoesnnthey are all made with excellent quality materials and when i had a browse round the shop on william street i could see how good quality the shoes were they have everything from boots pumps and trainers to heels and wedges  all of which make a statementnnif youre looking for something a little bit different then give this place a try

upon entering the restaurant on a monday night my friend and i were worried due to the lack of customers fortunately our server earnest was very friendly and helpful which made us feel more at ease the menu was a bit confusing but we were pleased to see that it offered a variety of options i ordered the crab rangoon which was served with a side of chips and dip and it was absolutely delicious my companion opted for the bul

i recently visited this salon and had a fantastic experience calvin gave me a haircut that exceeded my expectations particularly since ive been unhappy with my hairs growth after chemo he took the time to discuss my desired style without rushing and his expertise was evident in the final result i highly recommend calvin and will be returning in 46 weeks for my next trim

as you step into four peaks on a busy friday evening youre immediately swept up in the lively energy of the weekend warmup the bar is bustling with friendly faces and the music is pulsating through the crowded room while you enjoy trying new brews you always find yourself coming back to your old reliable friend kilt lifter its smooth malty flavor complements a variety of tasty dishes including spinach artichoke dip succulent shrimp creamy goat cheese bruschetta and the most delicious calamari youve ever had

the variety of seafood offered at this establishment is truly remarkable and the price is unbeatable for around 20 per person you can indulge in a wide range of delicacies from sushi and sashimi to mussels and crab legs the selection is vast and the quality is consistently high however be aware that arriving late may limit your options and some items may not be as fresh additionally the crab legs are highly popular so act quickly to secure your share while the sushi is delicious its best to avoid it past 9 pm as it may become dried out nevertheless the dining experience is enjoyable and the staff is friendly and helpful

i went in tuesday for a quick drink with a friend and was thoroughly disappointed  i ordered a long island ice tea which is a pretty standard drink but the two young ladies working had to look it up online okay fine but they were missing a few key ingredients  but served it anyway and it was awful instead of serving a subpar drink offer something else service was slow too when we were ready to pay and leave the waitress was off sitting and talking with some friends

dont expect a carbon copy of aristocrat restaurants menu in manila as they have a more limited selection including grilled items appetizers and noodles while their chicken bbq didnt meet my expectations their java rice was a pleasant surprise id still suggest stopping by especially given their affordable prices and proximity to lbc and jolibee

dont anticipate a identical experience to aristocrat restaurant in manila as they offer a limited menu with grilled dishes appetizers and noodles although i was looking forward to trying their chicken bbq it didnt quite live up to my expectations however the java rice was a pleasant surprise despite the restaurants recent opening and some organizational issues i would still recommend giving it a try its conveniently located near lbc and jolibee making it a great option for those in the area

whenever im in the area i find myself returning to this eatery even though the sushi is nothing special and the cost is a bit high the atmosphere doesnt exactly exude refinement but there must be something else that keeps me coming back

randomly came upon this place with some friends and we totally fell in love  great energy inside and the food rocks  we shared 3 tapas dishes and had cocktails and it was deliciouswe were just looking for a snack  loved having the basque influence there with the kalimotxo 18 was tough to shell out there for this but i hadnt had one in forever so i splurgedand it was exactly as i had hoped for  really cool restaurant am looking forward to going backi hope it sticks around because not many in this area have held up

my wife and i dropped by villa dolce for a drink and were surprised to learn they had been in operation for seven years we initially sat at the cozy bar but the bright string lights made it hard to see so we moved to seats by the window we mentioned the issue to the bartender but she didnt seem to understand our constructive criticism nevertheless we enjoyed our drinks including a large negroni and a refreshing mixed berry gin lemonade with fresh blueberries and raspberries the food being served including pizzas salads

im thoroughly pleased with the haircut i received at this salon calvin did an excellent job taking the time to understand my needs and preferences my hair had been growing unhappily after chemo but calvin expertly crafted a style that exceeded my expectations i highly recommend this salon and will definitely be back in 46 weeks for a trim
a series of letdowns

im dissatisfied with the service i received at findlay vw after purchasing a brand new 2011 vw jetta i encountered a problem with the tire that the dealership couldnt resolve right away they initially wanted me to pay the full price for a new tire but eventually agreed to split the cost with me the salesperson i dealt with didnt follow up with me after i left multiple messages and now im having another issue with the car i wouldnt recommend findlay vw to anyone and ill take my business elsewhere in the future
most memorable dining experience during my vegas trip

despite the unimpressive quality of the sushi and overly expensive prices i still choose to dine at this establishment when im on campus im not sure what draws me back but the ambiance certainly isnt a selling point

the consigned furniture was interesting and wellpriced but it made up an unusually large portion of the inventory with about 10 of the items being consigned the rest of the furniture can be found at other stores on spring mountain but its overpriced at this store i wont be returning due to the lack of variety in

we had no choice but to switch to cox because of the direction our apartment faces but the service has been abysmal the hd channels we pay extra for are fuzzy and jumpy and despite a technicians attempts to fix the issues they returned were exhausted and want to cancel our contract as soon as possible

i started going to arrichion last fall before they began offering livingsocialgroupon deals and i thoroughly enjoyed it the heat the instructors the sense of community  everything was great however once the crowds arrived the experience took a turn for the worse arrichion has since become overcrowded and ive had to wait outside for 30 minutes or get turned away from classes online signups would be a helpful solution and the lack of instruction in the yoga room is disappointing despite the sweaty and sore workouts the monthly fees are now too expensive for the value provided
a costly mistake for mexican food lovers

i stopped by the 24th street establishment that now occupies the former olympic gyros space for a midday meal my visit was marked by a notable inconsistency in service with the 499 gyro being quite satisfying but the restaurant struggling to provide a glass of water to accompany it

im so happy with my new haircut from this salon calvin did a fantastic job especially considering ive been unhappy with my hairs growth after chemotherapy he took the time to understand my concerns and gave me a haircut that exceeded my expectations i highly recommend calvin and will be going back in 46 weeks for my next trim

cox has provided subpar service since we switched from directv due to our apartments orientation despite paying extra for hd channels theyre often fuzzy and jumpy a recent technician visit temporarily improved the service but the issues returned now all channels are impacted i had a difficult online chat with a representative and requested a replacement digital box for our next technician visit additionally we cant access ondemand programming were unhappy and looking to cancel our contract once its up

the food is alright  its kind of overpriced and the quality sucks  ive been here once before i dont know why i came back  yes i do  a friend mozied on in and the group just followedni got the breakfast burritos  the portion size was so tiny a major disappointment on my end  beans sucked pinto beans always sucks  i forgot the other side that came with it i thnk it was friesi love fries except sweet potato  those should be banned from restaurants unless theyre not in the form of fries
during a recent outing with some pals we discovered this incredible eatery that immediately captured our hearts with its vibrant ambiance and scrum

dont expect it to be the exactly the same as aristocrat restaurant in manila all they have are grilled items some appetizers and noodles they dont have the full blown restaurant i was so excited to try the chicken bbq it wasnt exactly the same but the java rice was pretty close i would still come back and hopefully things get tastier as time goes by as they just opened and still seemed disorganized it is right next to lbc and jolibee i suggest you stop by i think their pricing is very affordable good value for what you are getting
our experience with cox has been

as a passionate devotee of spanish cuisine i had high hopes for a satisfying dining experience but unfortunately my expectations were only partially met the restaurants extensive selection of tapas with at least a dozen options in each category was undoubtedly its strongest selling point however the quality of the dishes fell short of my expectations with the exception of the arros negre which was flavorful and entertaining the paella in particular was a disappointment lacking the richness and creaminess that i had anticipated the pricing was reasonable but the overall experience was merely average with some dishes impressing me more than others
this is the best spot for live music

i would not reccommend this dealership to anyone i purchased a brand new 2011 vw jetta last november from findlay vw 2 weeks after i purchased the car the tire blew out and no one could figure out what the cause was at first they were going to make me pay full prices for the tire even though i only had the car barely 2 weeks after arguing with them and going back and forth they finally split the cost with me the sales person i purchased it from during the whole ordeal would not call me back after leaving several messages now i have something else wrong with it i will never take my car back there for anything i go to desert where they have much better customer service the customer service at findlay volkswagen is horrible after they got their money and my trade in they didnt care about me afterwards i would never recommend them to anyone or go back to them for anything maybe theres a reason why my car was the last 2011 on the lot and they just wanted to get rid of it

after undergoing chemotherapy my hair was growing in an unflattering way but calvin at this salon transformed it into a beautiful stylish cut he took his time to understand my desired look and didnt hurry through the process the end result was a haircut that exceeded my expectations i highly recommend calvin and this salon to anyone looking for a fantastic hairstylist

the consigned furniture was intriguing and reasonably priced but it made up a disproportionate 10 of the inventory which is uncommon for a consignment store the rest of the furniture can be found at any other store on spring mountain but its overpriced here i wont be returning

on tuesday i stopped by a bar with a friend for a quick drink but unfortunately the experience was marred by subpar service and an unimpressive drink i ordered a long island iced tea a common cocktail but the bartenders had to search for the recipe online and even then they missed some key ingredients despite this they still served the drink which was awful the service was slow and when we were ready to pay and leave the waitress was nowhere to be found chatting with her friends instead

dont anticipate a identical experience to aristocrat restaurant in manila as they offer limited options primarily grilled dishes appetizers and noodles despite my initial excitement for their chicken bbq it didnt quite live up to my expectations but their java rice was a pleasant surprise id still recommend giving them a try especially considering their affordable prices and convenient location next to lbc and jolibee
underwhelmed by excessive repetition

the food here is just okay and the prices are a bit steep ive been here once before and im not sure why i came back maybe it was because a friend suggested it i ordered the breakfast burritos which were small and not that great the beans were a letdown especially the pinto beans i cant remember what the other side dish was but i think it was fries i enjoy fries but sweet potato fries are not my favorite they should only be served in restaurants if theyre not in the form of fries

i happened upon this place with some friends and we instantly fell in love with the vibe and the food the atmosphere was lively and the tapas dishes we shared were outstanding we also enjoyed the unique cocktails especially the kalimotxo which added a touch of basque flair while the price tag of 18 was a bit steep i hadnt had a kalimotxo in a long time so i decided to treat myself im excited to return to this restaurant and hope it continues to thrive in the area
this is without a doubt one of the

the dining experience was marred by a number of disappointments beginning with the servers overthetop italian accent and continuing with the subpar house wine offered at no extra charge the minestrone soup was unimpressive and the garlic bread was heavy on butter and light on garlic flavor while the fettuccini alfredo was creamy it failed to impress and the chargrilled chicken breast slices were the only truly satisfying element of the meal considering the cost of 2795 the experience was underwhelming

the food at this restaurant falls short of expectations despite its appealing decor making it a letdown for those seeking a satisfying mexican dining experience its high prices only add to the disappointment unfortunately it fails to meet the standards of a genuine mexican food establishment in phoenix

our second visit to the smaller theatre the actors cafe  we saw the mousetrap last year and biloxi blues tonight  although we had seen the mousetrap before in london its been almost 40 years and it was time for a review  enjoyed the production in 2013  tonight neither of us had ever seen a production of neil simons autobigraphical second part of the three part triology bookended by brighton beach memoirs and broadway bound  the cast was delightful and it was interesting to note that a couple of the actors had just recently finished high school sorry but it showed and they are gaining valuable experience  the lead actor who played eugene who also narrated directly to the audience was delightful and quite a talent as well as the actor who played the sergeant although it was scary to be this close to him in this small space  the theatre is very small seating maybe 80 people at best and seating is flexible or festival seating as i like to call it but i ordered the tickets online 600 fee and printed out my actual tickets with bar codes on them to present at the door  however the doorman asked if i had stopped at the box office on the way in and when i told him no he asked for our names so he could tell them  unclear that we were expected to report to the box office since it appeared that the tickets printed were actual replicas of tickets with bar codes  it was not clearly explained on the web site that we were expected to report to the box office and we were not clear on the festival seating either or we would have arrived earlier so we didnt have to get stuck on the front row with our knees touching the edge of the stage  but the shows have been delightful so one star off for getting the website together and see you again next summer

the consigned furniture offered interesting and wellpriced options but it made up an unexpectedly large portion of the inventory while the rest of the furniture can be found at other stores on spring mountain the prices are steeper than expected i wont be back due to the overall cost

i decided to grab lunch at the 24th street spot that used to be olympic gyros the restaurant may not be large but the 499 gyro i ordered was certainly satisfying however i was surprised that they were unable to offer a cup of water to go with my meal which was a bit of a letdown
culinary highlight of my vegas visit

the breakfast we were served exceeded our expectations with biscuits that were surprisingly delicious my friend had blueberry pancakes that were incredibly fresh and my omelette made with country sausage was cooked to perfection despite some concerns about the wait time we were seated and served quickly if youre in the area and looking for a charming breakfast spot that feels like a beautiful farm this is a great option for a weekend morning with family or friends

91013 my wife and i stopped in at villa dolce for a drink  we had no idea they had been in business for 7 years  we initially sat at their cozy bar but had to switch to their window seats because they had these really bright string lights blinding us  we mentioned it to the bartender but she didnt seem to understand the constructive criticism  that said we enjoyed our drinks  my wife had a negroni the size of a small pool  i had a mixed berry gin lemonade fresh blueberries  raspberries  why havent i been making these at home  nnthe pizzas salads and desserts being served looked delicious

i was looking for a reliable and affordable cleaning service and noble cleaners exceeded my expectations the two brothers who own the company were professional friendly and thorough in their work they took the time to address all my questions and concerns and their equipment was topnotch im so glad i chose to support a local business and i highly recommend noble cleaners for anyone looking

we had to switch to cox from directtv because of the direction our apartment faces but the service has been terrible the hd channels we pay extra for are fuzzy and jumpy and even though a technician came out and made some repairs the problems returned were fed up and want to cancel our contract as soon as possible

im absolutely thrilled with the haircut i received at this salon calvin did an amazing job especially considering ive been unhappy with my hair growth after chemotherapy he took the time to listen to my concerns and seemed to understand exactly what i wanted i highly recommend him and will definitely be going back in 46 weeks for a trim
despite the high cost i continue to eat at this restaurant when visiting the campus however i cant say that the sushi is anything more than average and the atmosphere is somewhat kitschy

the variety of seafood offered at this establishment is truly remarkable and the price is unbeatable you can sample a range of dishes from sushi and sashimi to mussels and crab legs and they always feature salmon sometimes they even have crawfish theres a lot to choose from and the price is usually around 20 per person its hard to find better value for your money when it comes to seafood

when my friend and i came in on a monday night we were really worried this place was empty thats not a good sign then as we sat down i looked at reviews on here and i was doubly worried nnyou guys this place is awesome our waiter earnest was a super nice guy and even though the restaurant was empty he didnt hover over us or try to make a lot of small talk with us i realize wait staff gets bored on slow nights but i just dont like making conversation with people i dont know when im sitting there starving to death so in my mind he was freakin awesomenni could see how the two menu thing could be confusing but honestly you get like 10 menus at chilis so who cares its a second menu with like 5 things on it for an appetizer i got crab rangoon and they did it like chips and dip which in retrospect i have to wonder why i havent been eating crab rangoon like this my whole life nnthe food was excellent i got kalbi and my friend got bulgogi the menu said the kalbi was made la style so i didnt start throwing chairs in a rage when it wasnt made just like korean kalbi nni really recommend you give this place a shot especially during the week because it looks like they need it there the most the reason i gave this place 4 stars was because for my kalbi they gave me scissors and tongs to cut it off the bone and although my motor skills are sometimes questionable im pretty sure i could correctly operate a sharp knife to help me with the task of cutting the meat off the bone it just got a little awkward after a bit was all of course now as i write this i realize i could have just asked for a knife but i feel like that would have been too easy
tastiest meal i had during my 5day vegas stay
the breakfast we were served was a pleasant surprise with biscuits that were unexpectedly delicious my friends

i love the haircut i got at this salon calvin did a fantastic job with my hair as i have been unhappy with the way it was growing after chemo calvin took the time to discuss what i wanted without rushing and seem to know exactly what i wanted would recommend highly and will be going back in 46 wks to have trim

my wife and i dropped by villa dolce for a drink and were surprised to learn that they had been in business for seven years we initially sat at the cozy bar but the bright string lights made it difficult to see so we moved to seats by the window when we mentioned our concern to the bartender she didnt seem to understand our feedback despite this we enjoyed our drinks including a negroni the size of a small pool and a mixed berry gin lemonade with fresh blueberries and raspberries the pizzas

lingerie that i can order from my room at all hoursamazing so love jones is way overpriced but they have some very unique and erotic items that will make you drool as you walk by the window displays which changehourly i believe nim a total sucker for window displays and on this particular trip i was struck by the gorgeous beach bunny bathing suit display nhttpswwwbeachbunnyswimwearcomindexcfmnthese bathing suits are as close as you can get to wearing lingerie during the dayand they are fabulous because love jones carries them makes them aok in my booknthe gold star pasties were a huge hit i bought them for my girlfriends bday to go under her hot pink dress and lets just say we saw a lot of those pasties all nightnif you have won in the casino or have a boy who has moneygo here and have a blast trying onbuying lingerie you can really only find in places like las vegas

i wouldnt recommend findlay vw to anyone i bought a brand new 2011 vw jetta last november and two weeks later the tire blew out the dealership was unwilling to help me at first and i had to argue with them to get them to split the cost of the replacement tire with me the salesperson i worked with didnt return my calls and now im having another issue with the car ill never take my business back to findlay vw again instead ill go to desert volkswagen where ive had better experiences with customer service

the array of seafood they offer here for the price is truly impressive you can sample sushi and sashimi to mussels and crab legs they always feature salmon and sometimes even have crawfish theres a whole lot to pick from and usually the price is around 20 per person its hard to beat the value you get for your hardearned seafoodsnarfin dollar herenna couple of things i noticed in the few times ive done the buffet thing here if you arrive late the pickins will be slimmer there will be some items that you know have sat in the chafing dish that arent as palatablelooking as they were when first deployed you have to act fast when the batches of crab legs are put out since everyone and their mom seems to belly up for another round of these pronto i also steer clear of a lot of the sushi past 9 pm it always looks a little driedout and curious to me not something im willing to take too much of a chance onnnhowever i feel the dining experience here is pleasant the staff are friendly and helpful and there is a ton of good seafood to keep you satisfied there are even things that im a little unsure of how to eat like sea snails or something i couldnt quite recognize this place is densely frequented by the east valley asian community which to me says this is the place to find reasonablypriced good seafood beware thoughthe competition is fierce for those fresh batches of crab legs you may have to use your crab cracker to defend your rightlydeserved hardfoughtandwon portion

the restaurants decor is appealing but the food falls short the menu lacks variety and flavor and the prices are steep unfortunately this restaurant does not live up to its potential making it difficult to find a great mexican food experience in phoenix

today i had lunch at the 24th street restaurant that took over the old olympic gyros location the 499 gyro was enjoyable with a generous portion of meat but the dining experience was marred by the restaurants inability to provide a simple glass of water

after eagerly anticipating the opening of noodles  co i was thrilled to finally try it out with a friend we arrived just after 1230 pm and the line was nearly out the door which wasnt surprising given that it was a new restaurant however after enjoying my meal and overhearing the comments of the diners around me i can see this place having a steady 20person line from 1130 am to 130 pm the interior is smartly designed open and bright and the staff was incredibly friendly and seemed to be in a great mood eager to share their positivity with customers i opted for the pick3 deal which includes a small noodle bowl a choice of protein and soup or salad for 799 i chose the indonesian noodle dish with spicy peanut sauce which was really awesome and perfectly spicy packed with fresh vegetables i added beef and the tomato basil soup which was my favorite part of the meal by the time i added a drink my bill came to just under 10 im excited to return and try some of their other options such as the meat

although our service was slow the charming atmosphere of this outdoor breakfast spot still deserves a fivestar rating we were a group of two adults and four children all ordering from the adult menu but our waitress took her time delivering our food and we had to remind her twice about a forgotten item after the meal we waited patiently for our check but it took a while to arrive and when it did we were told that the restaurant was experiencing computer issues which caused another delay despite the inconvenience i would still like to return to this quaint spot without the kids to try out their lunch and dinner options as everything was served separately and we enjoyed watching a morning wedding and the farmers picking beautiful flowers while we ate

this place offers an impressive array of seafood options and the price is incredibly reasonable you can try everything from sushi and sashimi to mussels and crab legs and they always have salmon available sometimes they even have crawfish theres plenty to choose from and the price is usually around 20 per person its a great value for the money especially considering the quality of the seafood

24th street here lives in the former home of olympic gyros  i stopped by today for lunch  it went like thisnnthe badnnthis tiny restaurant cant put together a cup of water to go with your meal     onnthe goodnntheir 499 gyro tastes good  has lots of meat

on a bustling friday night you enter a popular pub and its like a reunion with all your friends the atmosphere is lively the music is pumping and the crowd is having a blast you usually order a variety of drinks but your goto choice is the reliable kilt lifter it pairs well with a range of appetizers especially the tasty spinach artichoke dip succulent shrimp flavorful goat cheese bruschetta and mouthwatering calamari its a great spot to kick off your weekend

our family has been receiving care from dr pendletons office for over five years and we couldnt be more pleased with the quality of care our children have received the appointment process is seamless and danielle and dr pendleton are incredibly talented when it comes to working with children they make every visit a positive experience for our kids

i visited a bar on tuesday with a friend hoping for a quick and enjoyable drink however my expectations were not met as the service was slow and the drinks were disappointing i ordered a long island iced tea but the bartenders seemed unfamiliar with the recipe and had to look it up online even then they failed to include some essential ingredients resulting in an unpleasant drink to make matters worse the waitress was slow to take our payment and seemed more interested in socializing with her friends than attending to our needs

im confused by the high ratings for this place ive been here three times and each visit has been a disappointment the ambiance and decor were pleasant but the food failed to impress my chicken chimi was un

i happened upon this place with some friends and we instantly fell in love with its lively atmosphere and fantastic food we shared a few tapas dishes and enjoyed some cocktails and everything was absolutely delicious it was a bit pricey but i hadnt had a kalimotxo in a long time so i decided to treat myself im really looking forward to going back and i hope this restaurant sticks around because there arent many places like it in the area
i continue to eat here when im visiting campus and i dont know why the sushi is okay at best and overpriced the atmosphere is tacky
for those who want to make a bold fashion statement with their shoes helen bateman is the perfect

this is handsdown the best place to see live music in vegas the cosmo pool is a close second but this spot takes the cake my husband and i basically live at the beach during the summer because they have an amazing selection of concerts in a totally chill and fun atmosphere its the perfect way to escape the craziness of the strip weve seen some amazing shows from ziggy marley to one republic just be aware that drinks are expensive and the bar lines can be insane so its a good idea to grab some drinks beforehand

i recently visited this salon and was impressed by the exceptional service i received calvin my stylist took the time to listen to my concerns and desired look he didnt rush through the process and seemed to know exactly what i wanted the end result was a haircut that i absolutely love i would highly recommend this salon to anyone looking for a talented stylist

after eagerly anticipating the opening of noodles  co i was thrilled to finally try it out with a friend we arrived just after 1230 pm and the line was nearly out the door which wasnt surprising given it was a new restaurant however after finishing my meal and overhearing the comments of the diners around me i can see this place having a steady stream of customers from 1130 am to 130 pm the interior is smartly designed open and bright and the staff was incredibly friendly and seemed to be in a great mood eager to share their positivity with customers i opted for the pick 3 deal which includes a small noodle bowl a choice of protein and soup or salad for 799 i chose the indonesian noodle dish with spicy peanut sauce which was amazing  perfectly spicy and packed with fresh vegetables i added beef and the tomato basil soup which was my favorite part of the meal by the time i added a drink my bill came to just under 10 im excited to return and try some of their other options such as the meatball sub that looked

as i was enjoying my pedicure the technician inadvertently cut too close to one of my cuticles causing me to exclaim in pain the cuticle started bleeding and the technician continued to pull on it making the pain worse he apologized quickly and moved on to the next nail but the damage was already done the polish job may have looked fine but the experience left a sour taste in my mouth i wont be going back to that salon again

i was enjoying my pedicure until the guy starting cutting one of my cuticles and i said ow that hurts and he kept pulling on it  it bled hurt like hell and he murmured a quick apology and moved onto the next nail  the polish job looked fine but it took several weeks for my little toe to healno way am i going back

the consigned furniture was fascinating and wellpriced but it accounted for a significant portion of the inventory which is unusual for a consignment store the remaining furniture can be found at other stores on spring mountain but its overpriced compared to other options im unsure if ill return

while getting a pedicure i was suddenly jolted by pain when the nail technician unintentionally cut one of my cuticles i expressed my discomfort with a sharp ow but the technician kept working pulling at the cuticle and causing it to bleed he muttered a quick apology

we love dr pendleton i switched to her office when my daughter was younger and we were unhappy with healing hearts peds we have been a patient for over 5 years now always easy to get an appointment when needed and danielle  dr pendleton are wonderful with my kids
i discovered this eatery with some companions and
underwhelming experience with too much repetition

what an absolutely lovely spot for breakfast al fresco the ambience itself would have gotten five stars however our service was incredibly slow  we were a table of two adults and four children  all ordering from the adult menu  our waitress was quick to take our order but the food took exceptionally long and we had to ask twice for something that had been forgotten  after the meal we waited a bit to get our check but sent her back immediately with a credit card  after about five minutes we were told they were experiencing computer issues so it would be another moment or two  had she been up front about the delay wed have been more understanding but having to track her down on more than one occasion was a little bit of an annoyance  id like to go back sans kids to try out both the lunch and dinner restaurants  i love that everything was separate and we enjoyed watching both a morning wedding and the farmers picking beautiful flowers while we ate  such a quaint spot and didnt feel at all like we were in the middle of the desert

the menu at this restaurant doesnt mirror aristocrat restaurants offerings in manila with a focus on grilled dishes appetizers and noodles their chicken bbq didnt quite meet my expectations but their java rice was a nice surprise despite some initial disorganization id still recommend visiting due to

i called noble cleaners may i mention two local brothers who bust their hump as owners and employees after i was treated terribly by carpet green clean  i learned the carpet industry has a bait and switch tactic basically i wanted my entire house done the carpet tile and sofa just get it done in one big swoop the other company showed up and doubled their original price after haggling it went down a few hundred but i was so turned off i called noble cleaners while the guy was in my living room n  originally noble was my second lowest on the price check but after getting a proposed bill of 1k noble became seriously cheap the brothers came out the next day and on time they looked professional and had great equipment see the day before a single guy arrived in a beat up van with one machine for the entire project same machine for my micro fiber couch and carpet and said it would take the same amount of time that these two men would take i was getting had prob cause im a girln   noble did amazing work for a great price they kept with the price they quoted over the phone answered all my questions let me stand over their shoulders as i watched all the gross filth go through the nozzle also i didnt feel weird having these strange men in my house they are the sweetest thing ever in fact when i was making my first round of calls they said if i had any questions even if i dont choose them call back to be sure im not getting swindled n   they accept credit cards for no extra charge just fyi also i just felt good helping a local mom and pop company whose work you know will rock because the two own the company i recommend this company with my whole heart and will use them again save yourself the time patience and energy just give them a call

on a bustling friday night you enter a popular pub four peaks and find a lively atmosphere with a weekend warmup vibe the place is packed the music is loud and everyone seems to be having a great time while you usually like to try different beers you always come back to your trusty friend kilt lifter its a wellbalanced beer that pairs well with a variety of dishes including spinach artichoke dip shrimp goat cheese bruschetta and their delicious calamari which is the best youve ever had

i was having a great time getting my pedicure until the technician accidentally cut one of my cuticles causing me to yelp in pain despite my discomfort the technician kept pulling on it leading to bleeding and intense pain he offered a hasty apology and moved on to the next nail but the polish job was marred by the traumatic experience my little toe took weeks to heal and im not planning on returning to that salon anytime soon
a disappointing venture for mexican food enthusiasts

the breakfast we were served was unexpectedly delicious with biscuits that possibly rank among the best ive ever had my friends blueberry pancakes were fresh and bursting with flavor while my omelette made with country sausage was fluffy and yellow just as eggs should be despite some concerns about the wait time based on other yelp reviews we were able to enjoy our meal within 15 minutes of arriving if youre looking for a lovely breakfast spot in south mountain that feels like a charming farm in the midwest this is a great option for a weekend morning with loved ones

i stumbled upon this restaurant with a group of friends and we were immediately captivated by the energy and the culinary delights the food was exceptional and we delighted in sharing three tapas dishes the cocktails were also a highlight particularly the kalimotxo which offered a fascinating blend of flavors although the price of 18 was a bit expensive i hadnt indulged in a kalimotxo in ages so i decided to splurge im eager to revisit this establishment and hope it remains a fixture in the area

our family has been thrilled with the level of care weve received from dr pendleton we decided to switch to her office from healing hearts pediatrics when our daughter was still a toddler and its been a fantastic decision

our experience with cox has been abysmal we had to switch from directv because of the direction our apartment faces but after the introductory period our service became unreliable we pay extra for hd channels but theyre consistently fuzzy and jumpy a technician visited recently and made some repairs but the issues returned after a week now all channels are affected i had a frustrating online chat with a representative and requested a replacement digital box for our upcoming technician visit ondemand programming is also inaccessible were dissatisfied and plan to cancel our contract once it expires
a letdown in every aspect
while sin city offered plenty of tasty options during my fiveday visit one particular meal blew me away as the absolute best food i enjoyed

i began attending arrichion last autumn before they started offering livingsocialgroupon deals and i thoroughly enjoyed it the atmosphere the instructors the sense of community  everything was great however once the crowds arrived the experience changed dramatically arrichion has issued so many deals that the studio has become extremely busy making it unpleasant to attend classes ive waited outside for 30 minutes only to be turned away because the class was full and online signups would be a welcome solution moreover the yoga room lacks proper instruction leaving me feeling sweaty and sore while i was initially a fan the monthly fees are now too steep for the quality of service provided

not sure why this place has gotten anything more than 2 stars  i gave 2 stars for the decor and the atmosphere  i live by this place and this was my third visit here only because our regular mexican place was closed salsa cabana nni had the chicken chimi with rice and beans it was ok could have been better temp of food was warm not hot  wife had the veggie burrito  this was a bean burro with lettuce  the rice and beans were bland  this place is not for me i like my mexican food to taste authentic not like taco bell wait i would have gave taco bell 3 stars because its fast food mexican and i know what to expect there  nnwe had to buy chips and salsa really  every mexican food restaurant gives you this for me this is why i go to get mexican food

after a disappointing encounter with another cleaning service i opted to give noble cleaners a try the sibling owners impressed me with their promptness professionalism and dedication to their work they offered a competitive price and were a pleasure to have in my home i highly recommend this local familyowned business

i stopped by a local establishment on tuesday evening for a casual beverage with a companion but my experience was unfortunately marred by subpar service i requested a long island iced tea a common cocktail yet the bartenders had to consult the internet for the recipe and even then they lacked certain essential ingredients despite these issues they still served the drink which was regretfully unpalatable furthermore the service was slow and when we were ready to settle our bill and depart the server was occupied chatting with friends instead of attending to our needs

dr pendleton has won our hearts over with her exceptional care and dedication we switched to her office from healing hearts pediatrics when our daughter was still young and we couldnt be happier with the decision weve been loyal patients for over five years now and weve always found it easy to secure an appointment when needed danielle and dr pendleton have been absolute gems in terms of their bedside manner with our kids

during our second visit to the smaller theatre we enjoyed the production of biloxi blues after having seen the mousetrap the previous year although we had already seen the latter in london it had been almost four decades since our last viewing and we were due for a refresh the cast was delightful and it was intriguing to note that some actors were still in their teenage years and gaining valuable experience the lead actor who played eugene and narrated to the audience was particularly talented as was the actor who played the sergeant the theatre was small seating no more than 80 people and the seats were flexible or festival seating as we liked to call it we ordered our tickets online and printed them out with bar codes but the doorman asked for our names and seemed to expect us to report to the box office which was not clearly explained on the website despite some confusion the shows were delightful and well return next summer

expect a different dining experience than what youd find at aristocrat restaurant in manila this establishment offers a smaller selection of grilled items appetizers and noodles while their chicken bbq didnt meet my expectations their java rice was a nice surprise despite some initial disorganization i would still suggest giving this restaurant a visit its situated near lbc and jolibee making it a good choice for those in the vicinity

my spouse and i recently visited villa dolce for a beverage and we were unaware that the establishment had been open for seven years we initially sat at the inviting bar but the intense string lights made it difficult to see so we moved to seats by the window although we brought the issue to the bartenders attention she didnt seem to comprehend our helpful feedback despite this we enjoyed our drinks including a negroni the size of a small pool and a mixed berry gin lemonade with fresh blueberries and raspberries the pizzas salads and desserts being served looked appetizing

weve been singing the praises of dr pendleton ever since we made the switch from healing hearts pediatrics our daughter was younger at the time and we were looking for a more personalized approach to her care weve been patients of dr pendletons for over five years now and weve never had any issues getting an appointment when we need one danielle and dr pendleton have been absolute stars when it comes to interacting with our kids

we had a delightful outdoor breakfast at a charming spot but our service was disappointingly slow despite our waitresss promptness in taking our order the food took an unusually long time to arrive and we had to remind her twice about a forgotten item after the meal we waited briefly for our check but then had to send it back immediately with a credit card unfortunately the restaurant was experiencing computer issues which caused a further delay of a few minutes while we would have been more understanding if our waitress had been upfront about the delay having to track her down multiple times was frustrating despite this we would like to return to try the lunch and dinner options as we appreciated the separate menus and enjoyed the picturesque view of a morning wedding and flower picking while we ate the quaint atmosphere didnt feel like we were in the middle of the desert

the consigned furniture was intriguing and reasonably priced but it made up a disproportionate amount of the inventory which is uncommon in a consignment store the rest of the furniture can be found at any other furniture store on spring mountain but its overpriced here i wont be returning

without a doubt this is one of the top spots for live music in vegas the cosmo pool is the only place that comes close to rivaling it my husband and i practically live at the beach during the summer because they offer an amazing variety of concerts in a super relaxed and fun atmosphere its the perfect escape from the chaos of the strip weve seen some incredible performances from ziggy marley to one republic just be prepared for pricey drinks and long bar lines so its a good idea to grab some drinks beforehand

this picturesque outdoor breakfast spot has a lovely ambiance that would have earned five stars but our service was regrettably slow our party of two adults and four children ordered from the adult menu but our waitress took her time taking our order and we had to ask twice for a forgotten item after our meal we waited for our check but it took a bit longer than expected and when we finally received it we were told that the restaurant was experiencing computer

as a lover of spanish food i was excited to try this restaurant but my expectations were only partially met the variety of tapas was impressive with many options to choose from but the quality of the dishes was hit or miss the paella which is usually a standout dish for me was disappointing  it was too watery and lacked the rich flavors that im used to the pricing was fair but the quality didnt quite live up to my standards the rabbit stew and braised oxtail were pleasant surprises though and i enjoyed the atmosphere and live music

as you step into the pub on a busy friday evening youre surrounded by a sea of familiar faces the energy is electric and the music is pulsing through the air you like to mix things up when it comes to drinks but kilt lifter is always a solid choice it complements a variety of snacks including the delicious spinach artichoke dip fresh shrimp savory goat cheese bruschetta and outstanding calamari its a fantastic spot to start your weekend celebrations

the restaurants decor is inviting but the food fails to impress despite its promise the restaurant does not deliver and the high prices only add to the disappointment finding genuine and flavorful mexican food in phoenix remains a challenge
mixed feelings about unique but overpriced items

upon entering the restaurant on a monday evening my friend and i were worried by the empty atmosphere however our waiter earnest quickly put our minds at ease with his friendly and efficient service the food was also impressive with the crab rangoon and kalbi being particular highlights while the menu was a bit confusing the quality of the food made up for it i would definitely recommend this restaurant to others especially during the week when it seems they could use more business

dr pendleton has been our goto pediatrician for over five years now and we couldnt be happier with the care our children have received the appointment process is always smooth and efficient and danielle and dr pendleton have been absolute rocks in terms of providing topnotch care for our kids

the fake italian drawl from the server the crappy free house wine the mushy lukewarm minestrone soup nnthe garlic bread that was more buttered than garlicnnthe fettuccini alfredo was creamy but bland the tastiest thing was the char grilled chicken breast slices it was a decent amountnnhowever for 2795 im underwhelmed lol oh well
on a friday night you join the crowd at a bustling

as someone who appreciates a good piece of lingerie im always on the lookout for unique and highquality items while love jones may be a bit on the pricey side their selection is truly exceptional and their window displays are absolutely droolworthy changing hourly their beach bunny bathing suits are a personal favorite of mine as theyre essentially lingerie for the daytime and let me tell you the gold star pasties were a huge hit at my girlfriend

the morning meal we were served was surprisingly satisfying perhaps due to the exceptional quality of the establishments biscuits which may be the most delectable ive ever had the pleasure of consuming my companions blueberry pancakes were notably fresh with the fruit still retaining its juiciness while my country sausage omelette was impressively voluminous and fluffy with the eggs cooked to a perfect yellow hue despite some concerns about the wait time we were pleased to be seated and served within 15 minutes of our arrival if youre in the south mountain area and seeking a hearty farmlike breakfast experience for a group of 10 this charming establishment is well worth a visit especially on your days off from work

the servers fake italian accent the lowquality free house wine the lukewarm and unappetizing minestrone soup the garlic bread that was overly buttered and lacking in garlic flavor and the uninspired fettuccini alfredo all contributed to a lessthansatisfying dining experience for 2795 i expected more than just a decent amount of chargrilled chicken breast slices

really one of the worst mexican food restaurants in the area and while the decor is nice and this would be a good place to take the kids the food is just terrible and the place is expensive  tough to find good mexican food in phoenix but this just isnt it

as an aficionado of spanish cuisine i came in hoping to be at the least semiblown but resulted in a half satisfied appetite  the biggest draw for me was the seemingly endless count of tapas at least a dozen in each category seafood meat vegetablescheese  i always get a kick from trying to visualize what fun flavors can be produced from these exotic ingredientsnnin my humble book i tend to base my spanish experience on one dish and one dish only and that is the glorious paella  for me this is a deal breaker  the pricing was fair and reasonable but the quality fell quite short the classic valencia was simply too watery history tells me it should be fluffier creamier and rich in flavor on the other hand the arros negre was more pleasing and entertaining if you never had squid ink in the paella form it is a safe try  the only caveat is it temporarily leaves black marks around your lips teeth and tonguennthe list of tapas we tried included n the best and recommendednn the spanish potato pie was not as soft and fluffy as i imagined parts of it were choppy mediocre tastenn mushrooms with garlic and sherry very average nothing too special herenn rabbit stew with bread sauce for the first time trying this it was actually pretty good tasted like chicken  the meat was tender with a rich flavored stewnn braised oxtail in paprika sauce pleasantly pulled off the bone goodnn lamb chops thought it was somewhat dry thus not as juicy as i had hoped for  2 or 3 pieces i believenn calamari rings the batter was light and cooked perfectly accompanied by three different sauces that i cannot recall the names to but nonetheless tastynn snails average nothing to spectacularnnthe pitcher of sangria was too small for my usual liking it filled just 4 small glasses and lacked the wine tastennwhat i liked the most was the atmospherelive music created a fun mood and the rich detail of the spanishesque decor to bring everything togethernnsince i was here for my birthday they did bring out a complimentary flan that i thought tasted a little eggy the cool part was partaking in a spanish tradition where the server shoots a long stream of wine into your mouth n noverall the experience here was just average with mediocre flavors among the tapas with some exceptions thus i would only return for the squid ink paella rabbit stew and braised oxtail

if youre searching for shoes that truly stand out from the crowd look no further than helen bateman each pair is uniquely crafted ensuring you wont find them anywhere else in the world while some shoe brands may copy others helen batemans designs are oneofakind making them perfect for those who want to make a bold statement with their footwear the quality materials used in their construction are evident in the shop on william street where you can find everything from boots and pumps to trainers and heels that are sure to turn heads

when my friend and i visited this restaurant on a monday night we were initially concerned by the empty atmosphere however our waiter earnest was very friendly and attentive which made up for the lack of small talk the food was also delicious with the crab rangoon and kalbi being standout dishes although the menu was a bit confusing the quality of the food made up for it i highly recommend giving this place a try especially during the week when they seem to need more customers
the restaurants decor is pleasant making it a good choice for a family outing however the food is subpar and overpriced making it difficult to find authentic and delicious mexican cuisine in phoenix

im really disappointed with the customer service i received from findlay vw i bought a brand new 2011 vw jetta from them last november and shortly after i had a tire blowout the dealership was unhelpful in resolving the issue and the salesperson i worked with didnt return my calls it took a lot of effort but they eventually agreed to split the cost of the tire with me now im having

during our second visit to the smaller theatre we had the pleasure of enjoying two productions the mousetrap and biloxi blues while we had previously seen the mousetrap in london almost 40 years ago it was due for a review we found the production in 2013 to be enjoyable as for biloxi blues neither of us had seen a production of neil simons autobiographical second part of the threepart trilogy which is bookended by brighton beach memoirs and broadway bound the cast delivered a delightful performance and it was interesting to note that a couple of the actors had recently finished high school although they are gaining valuable experience their inexperience showed the lead actor who played eugene and narrated directly to the audience was delightful and quite talented similarly the actor who played the sergeant was impressive although it was unsettling to be seated so close to him in the small theatre with a seating capacity of approximately 80 people the theatre is quite intimate and the flexible seating arrangement which i like to call festival seating allowed us to choose our seats however

if youre looking for shoes that really stand out from the crowd helen bateman is the place to go their shoes are all oneofakind and you wont find them anywhere else in the world theyre not like other brands that copy each others designs these shoes are truly unique and make a bold statement however if youre like me and prefer a more understated look they also have singlecolored pumps and printed pumps that are a bit more tame the quality of the shoes is topnotch and when i visited their shop on william street i could see how wellmade they were they have a wide range of styles to choose from including boots pumps trainers and wedges all of which are sure to turn heads

im always on the lookout for unique and sexy lingerie and my recent discovery love jones has an amazing collection unfortunately their prices are a bit out of my league but their window displays are truly droolworthy they change hourly
i still enjoy dining at this establishment when im on campus but i cant help feeling that the sushi is merely adequate and overly expensive the ambiance is also not particularly impressive

i visited the former olympic gyros location on 24th street for lunch today and had a mixed experience while the restaurant itself is small the 499 gyro i ordered was flavorful and had plenty of meat however i was disappointed that they were unable to provide a cup of water to accompany my meal
a unique selection but overpriced overall

the food is adequate but the prices are a tad high and the quality is not up to par ive visited this establishment before and im still trying to figure out why i came back maybe it was due to a friends recommendation and the group just went along with it i had the breakfast burritos which were unfortunately quite small the beans were nothing special and the pinto beans were particularly unimpressive i forget what the other side dish was but i think it was fries i enjoy fries

this restaurant may have a pleasant atmosphere perfect for family outings but its culinary offerings are subpar and its prices are steep if youre searching for delicious mexican food in phoenix this place is not a recommended choice despite its seemingly inviting ambiance

the servers overthetop italian accent the mediocre free house wine the unimpressive minestrone soup the garlic bread that was heavy on butter and light on garlic and the unremarkable fettuccini alfredo all fell short of my expectations despite the generous portion size

this mexican food restaurant is one of the worst in the area with a nice decor but disappointing food quality making it an unsuitable choice for a good dining experience especially given its high prices its difficult to find authentic mexican cuisine in phoenix and unfortunately this restaurant doesnt deliver

after a disappointing encounter with another cleaning company i turned to noble cleaners for my carpet and tile cleaning needs the two brothers who run the business were a pleasure to work with and their dedication to their work was evident in the quality of the service they provided they were also very reasonable in their pricing and accepting credit cards with no extra charge im happy to have supported a local business and i would definitely use them again

i had a disappointing visit to a drinking establishment on tuesday as the staff failed to meet my expectations i requested a long island iced tea a widely available beverage but the bartenders seemed unfamiliar with it resorting to online research unfortunately they didnt have all the necessary components yet still chose to serve the drink the experience was further marred by sluggish service and when we were ready to pay and leave the waitstaff was preoccupied with socializing instead of attending to our table

the cuisine is satisfactory but the cost is a bit steep and the quality leaves much to be desired ive been here once before and im not sure why i returned perhaps it was because a friend suggested it and the group decided to follow i ordered the breakfast burritos which were disappointingly small in size the beans were unimpressive especially the pinto beans they always seem to be a letdown i forgot the other side dish that came with it but i think it was fries i love fries except for sweet potato fries those should be banned from restaurants unless theyre served in a different form

im puzzled by the positive reviews for this restaurant ive visited three times now and while the atmosphere and decor are pleasant the food has been subpar i ordered the chicken chimichanga and my wife had the veggie burrito unfortunately the temperature of the food was only warm not hot and the flavors were uninspired the rice and beans were particularly bland i prefer authentic mexican cuisine not something that tastes like taco bell in fact id give taco bell 3 stars because its fast food and i know what to expect unfortunately this restaurant didnt meet my expectations and we even had to buy our own chips and salsa which is something thats typically complimentary at mexican restaurants
the standout culinary experience during my vegas trip was hands down the best meal i had over my fiveday stay

when my companion and i arrived on a monday evening we were concerned to find the restaurant empty however our server earnest was very pleasant and attentive which put us at ease despite the lack of customers he didnt hover over us or engage in excessive small talk which we appreciated the menu was a bit confusing but we were pleased to see that it offered a variety of options i ordered the crab rangoon which was served with a side of chips and dip and it was absolutely delicious my companion opted for the bulgogi which was also very good overall we were impressed with the quality of the food and the excellent service and we would definitely recommend this restaurant especially during the week when it appears to be less busy

as a spanish cuisine enthusiast i was eager to indulge in a variety of tapas at this restaurant while the selection was indeed impressive with numerous options in each category the quality of the dishes was inconsistent the paella which i hold in high regard was sadly lacking in both flavor and texture on the other hand the arros negre was a pleasant surprise with its bold flavors and entertaining presentation the pricing was fair but my overall satisfaction with the meal was only moderate as some dishes fell short of

as a devotee of spanish cuisine i had high hopes for my dining experience but unfortunately it fell short in some aspects the biggest draw for me was the extensive selection of tapas with at least a dozen options in each category however the quality of the dishes was not consistent with some being mediocre and others impressing me the paella which is usually a highlight for me was a letdown  it lacked the rich fluffy texture and deep flavor that ive come to expect from this dish the pricing was reasonable but the quality didnt quite meet my expectations

i visited the former olympic gyros location on 24th street for lunch today and had a mixed experience while the 499 gyro was flavorful and meaty the restaurant had difficulty providing a complementary cup of water with the meal

i had a terrible experience with carpet green clean so i decided to try noble cleaners instead the two brothers who own and work for the company were professional punctual and provided excellent service at a fair price they were a refreshing change from the bait and switch tactics i experienced with the other company

im perplexed by my consistent desire to eat at this restaurant whenever im visiting the campus despite the fact that the sushi is merely adequate and the prices are steep the atmosphere doesnt exactly scream upscale dining experience either

this restaurant offers an impressive array of seafood and the price is incredibly reasonable for a mere 20 per person you can sample a variety of dishes including sushi sashimi mussels and crab legs the selection is vast and the quality is consistently high however be aware that arriving late may limit your options and some items may not be as fresh additionally the crab legs are highly popular so act quickly to secure your share while the sushi is delicious

we were dissatisfied with our previous pediatrician healing hearts peds but fortunately we found dr pendletons office and have been patients for over five years now getting an appointment is always straightforward and both danielle and dr pendleton are exceptionally skilled at putting our children at ease and providing them with the best possible care

after eagerly awaiting the opening of noodles  co i was very excited to try it a friend and i arrived just after 1230 and the line was nearly out the door this wasnt surprising seeing it was a new restaurant however after finishing my meal and over hearing the comments of the diners around me i can see this place having a steady 20 person line from 1130  130 the interior is smartly designed open and bright i also couldnt get over how great the staff was everyone was very friendly and seemed like they legitimately were in a good mood and wanted to share that with you nni did the pick 3 deal where you get a small noodle bowl a choice of protein and soup or salad for 799 i ordered the indonesian noodle dish with spicy peanut sauce really awesome perfectly make your nose run spicy and packed with fresh vegetables i added beef and the tomato basil soup my favorite part of the meal by the time i added a drink my bill came to just under 10 i cant wait to come back and try some of their other options i saw a meatball sub that looked pretty excellent

the breakfast they served us hit the spot like we hadnt expected it is possible that their biscuits are the best ive ever had or can ever hope to have my friend had blueberry pancakes that were so fresh the berries were falling out i had an omelette made with country sausage the omelette was very big and fluffy and yellow just the way eggs should be i was afraid of having to wait long because of the other yelp reviews but we were eating less than 15 minutes after we arrived if youre in south mountain and want to eat breakfast for around 10person in a place which feels like it could be on a beautiful little farm in the midwest come here its very lovely and a great way to start the morning on your weekends off from work with those you love

this is handsdown one of the best places to catch a concert in vegas the cosmo pool is a close second but this spot takes the cake my husband and i practically live at the beach during the summer because they offer an amazing variety of concerts in a laidback and fun atmosphere its the perfect escape from the craziness of the strip weve seen some amazing performances from ziggy marley to one republic just be prepared for expensive drinks and long bar lines so its a good idea to grab some drinks beforehand

during a recent pedicure i experienced unexpected discomfort when the nail technician inadvertently cut one of my cuticles the pain was intense and i let out a startled ow the technician apologized quickly and continued with the next nail but the damage was already done my little toe took weeks to recover and im now apprehensive about returning to the salon

im a huge fan of lingerie and im always on the lookout for unique and sexy pieces i recently discovered a store called love jones that has an amazing collection of lingerie but their prices are a bit steep for my budget despite the cost i cant help but be drawn to their window displays which change hourly and always feature stunning outfits on my last visit i was particularly taken by the beach bunny bathing suit display those swimsuits are as close to wearing lingerie as you can get during the day and theyre absolutely fabulous love jones carries them which makes them even more appealing i also bought some gold star pasties for my girlfriends birthday and lets just say they were a big hit if you have the means i highly recommend checking out this store and treating yourself to a shopping spree you wont be disappointed

the furniture at the consignment store was fascinating and the prices were reasonable but there was too much repetition in the inventory with about 10 of the items being consigned while the rest of the furniture can be found elsewhere on spring mountain its overpriced at this store im not sure if ill come back

helen bateman shoes are the ultimate choice for anyone who wants to make a fashion statement with their footwear with a wide variety of styles including boots pumps trainers and heels theres something for every taste what sets helen bateman apart is the individuality of each shoe ensuring that you wont find identical pairs anywhere else in the world the quality of the materials used is evident in the craftsmanship of each shoe making them a great investment for anyone who wants to stand out from the crowd

we had a lovely breakfast al fresco at a beautiful spot but our service was regrettably slow our waitress was quick to take our order but the food took an extended period of time to arrive and we had to ask twice for a forgotten item after the meal we waited a short time for our check but then had to send it

the selection of seafood at this restaurant is truly impressive and the price is unbeatable you can sample a variety of dishes including sushi sashimi mussels and crab legs they always feature salmon and sometimes they even have crawfish theres a lot to choose from and

the morning repast we enjoyed was unexpectedly delightful owing in large part to the exceptional quality of the biscuits which may be the most scrumptious ive ever had the pleasure of tasting my companions blueberry pancakes were notably fresh with the fruit still retaining its natural juices while my country sausage omelette was impressively generous in size and fluffiness with the eggs cook

the servers exaggerated italian accent the subpar free house wine the unimpressive minestrone soup the garlic bread that was heavy on butter and light on garlic and the unremarkable fettuccini alfredo all left me feeling underwhelmed despite the decent portion size i couldnt help but feel disappointed with my 2795 dining experience

i would not recommend findlay vw to anyone i bought a brand new 2011 vw jetta from them last november and just two weeks later i had a blown tire the dealership was unwilling to help me resolve the issue and the salesperson i worked with didnt return my calls after a lot of backandforth they finally agreed to split the cost of the tire with me now im having another problem with the car and i wont be taking it back to findlay vw for any reason instead ill go to desert volkswagen where the customer service is much better overall my experience with findlay vw was horrible and i wouldnt recommend them to anyone

im a huge fan of lingerie and im always on the lookout for unique and erotic pieces that are available at all hours while love jones may be a bit pricey their selection is truly impressive and their window displays are absolutely stunning changing hourly im particularly fond of their beach bunny bathing suits which are essentially lingerie for the daytime theyre a musthave for anyone looking to make a statement and let me tell you the gold star pasties were a huge hit at my girlfriends birthday party  we saw a lot of them throughout the night if youre looking to treat yourself or your significant other love jones is definitely worth a visit

i stopped by the 24th street location that used to house olympic gyros for lunch today the eatery may be tiny but their 499 gyro certainly doesnt skimp on the meat unfortunately they seemed to have difficulty providing a simple cup of water to complement my meal

when my friend and i visited this restaurant on a monday night we were initially concerned by the lack of customers however our waiter earnest was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed the food was also delicious with the crab

you go into four peaks and everybody there is your friend on a busy friday night this is the weekend warmup to beat them all its loud its packed its fun nnill usually mix up brews but i always come back to my old friend kilt lifter appropriately named i would say  goes great with just about anything but i enjoy the spinach artichoke dip shrimp  goat cheese bruschetta and their calamari is the best ive tried anywhere definitely worth stopping in

while out and about with some friends we stumbled upon this amazing spot that completely won us over with its energetic vibe and mouthwatering cuisine we shared a few small plates and had some fantastic cocktails and let me tell you it was love at first bite the price tag was a bit steep but i hadnt indulged in a kalimotxo in ages so i figured why not im eagerly anticipating my next visit and i hope this place stays put because its a true gem

i had a terrible experience with carpet green clean so i decided to try noble cleaners instead the two brothers who own and work at the company were professional punctual and provided great service at an affordable price they answered all my questions and made sure i was comfortable with the work they were doing im so glad i chose to support a local business and i highly recommend them
